STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 26, 2025
Michelle Lynn Carlton
Judson CPA
3 Parklane Blvd Ste 730W, Suite 730W
Dearborn, MI, 48126-2502
RE: License#: CB820201212
Dear Ms. Carlton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/12/025. An exit conference was held with the agency on 6/16/2025. Due to the
violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB820201212
Licensee Group Organization: Judson Center
Licensee Designee: George Winn
Chief Administrator: Michelle Lynn Carlton
Name of Agency: JUDSON CPA
Agency Address: 3 PARKLANE BLVD STE 730W
Suite 730W
DEARBORN, MI 48126-2502

Applicants for adoption, Place children for
adoption, Place children in foster home,
Supervise Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(f) A dental re-examination must be obtained at least
every 9 months, unless a greater frequency is
indicated.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed showed the child's dental was
due by 8/28/2024 and one was not documented.
Repeat Violation Established:
Renewal 2023, CAP approved 8/8/2023.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents
and the foster parents in the development of service
plans to enable the parent or parents and foster
parents to understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting the
agency in carrying out the plan. An agency shall give a
copy to and review the parent-agency treatment plan

with the parent or parents and foster parents. The
agency must inform the parent or parents and foster
parent that the information in the parent-agency
treatment plan and any other information about the
child and the child's family is confidential.
Three of eight open foster child records reviewed lacked timely signatures
indicating involvement in service plan development.
Repeat Violation Established
Interim 2024, CAP approved 8/7/2024, cited under FOM 722-8D.
CPA Rule 400.12604 Orientation.
(1) An agency shall provide an orientation for
prospective applicants for adoption before an adoptive
application is provided.
In one of five adoptive family records reviewed the record showed the family's
application dated 1/24/2025 was dated before the family's 1/28/2025 orientation.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Two of five adoptive family records reviewed showed the family's adoption
evaluation was not completed within 90 days of the respective family's 5/30/2024
and 12/28/2024 adoption application date.
CPA Rule 400.12607 Agency recommendation.
(4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption
with a signed and dated copy of the evaluation and
recommendation upon its completion.
One of five adoptive family records reviewed showed the child's 7/28/2024
adoption evaluation was not provided to the family upon it it's completion as
required by the rule.
Repeat Violation Established

Renewal 2023, CAP approved 8/8/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
There was no technical assistance requested or required during this inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• R400.12212(2)(f) (g)Personnel record: The agency is advised if an
applicant’s/employee’s ICHAT results shows arrest information with the
charge and judicial sections left blank exploration of the arrest matter would
prove beneficial to ensure the person does not have a conviction and to
ensure compliance to these subrules.
• R400. 12417 Foster parent information: The agency was advised that
amending its placement/replacement form to include a heading, circumstance
leading to placement / replacement; and or having the foster parent to sign-off
on the placement outline form, may also aid it in demonstrating compliance
with the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period. That corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2024
Interim inspection where it received 9 rule violations. During this 2025 Renewal
inspection the agency received 5 rule violations, 1 is a repeat violation from 2024;
and 2 from the agency’s 2023 renewal inspection. The agency’s corrective action
plan compliance around these 3 rule violations is as follows: the number of
individual cases cited increased from 1 of 6 to 3 of 8 related to the repeat violation
from 2024. In terms of the repeat violations from 2023, the number of individual
cases cited decreased from 2 of 5 to 1 of 5 on the first; and the second citation
remained the same. A review of the agency’s 2024 Interim corrective action plan
showed it completed and or implemented all aspects of the corrective action plan.
The agency continues its efforts to gain greater compliance on all rules.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator’s (CA) report dated 6/3/2024. The CA
reported the agency has been more consistent in maintaining staff and the CAP

put in placed worked well with supervisors and staff when it was followed. The CA
reported a number of their staff have time-management and organizational issues,
and the program manager and new supervisor are working to provide those staff
with techniques to assist them. Additionally, the CA reported holding monthly CAP
review meetings was helpful to hold supervisors accountable for rule compliance;
and their institution of various checklists aids staff with compliance when the
checklists are utilized. The CA further reported the agency continues to offer
trauma and behavior management training to foster parents on a regular basis so
as to help the foster parent better understand a foster child’s behavior.
During the entrance conference the agency reported staff morale remains high;
and they have learned more structured training is needed for some staff. The
agency reported it is providing that extra training and support to staff. They also
reported recruitment of foster homes has been more difficult; some of which
centers around safety, as impacted by the foster parent tragedy that was in the
News. The agency reported it has continued to safeguard around this area; and
workers are doing more transporting of the foster children for parent/child visitation
as opposed to the foster parent.
Financial Overview
The agency provided a 2025 annual budget, and independent financial audit dated
for 9/30/2024 and 2023. A review of these documents did not show indications of
any notable areas of concern.
Staff Interviews
In addition to a discussion with the chief administrator, licensee designee, 2 foster
care supervisors, the licensing supervisor, and adoption supervisor, I interviewed
a licensing worker, adoption worker, foster care worker, and a foster care
supervisor. No concerns were reported. Areas of strengths cited by the staff
included, the agency having good workers and supervisors, the flexibility of the
job, all teams working well together to get things accomplished, and the many
resources offered foster parents, children’s families and staff. Areas mentioned as
needing improvement were turnaround time for business cards for new staff; and
ensuring that all teams are operating under the same expectations.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency's office did not reveal any safety concerns. There
appears to be sufficient equipment for staff; and case and program files were
securely stored.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert during this licensing period.
Safety Alert: The safety of the home could not be assessed. There were several
phone calls and text messages left for the foster parent and no response was
received from the foster parent.

Resolution: The agency’s licensing supervisor attempted to contact the foster parent
by telephone and text message on 4/28/2025. No response was received from the
foster parent; and therefore, a special evaluation was initiated on the foster home.
There are no children placed in the foster home.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
June 25, 2025
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 26, 2025

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
